intro: Sedum glaucovirens, commonly known as the Blue Ghost Sedum, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-gray leaves that form a dense, low-growing rosette. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink to purple during the summer months. It is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a striking addition to arid landscapes.
